intro: Alsophila binayana, commonly known as the Philippine tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, feather-like fronds. The plant has a distinctive crown of pinnate leaves that can reach several meters in length. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Alsophila binayana plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various organisms.
